DataElement.preferredDefinition: The surgical approach or technique used in executing the surgical procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-11; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an enumerated list of surgical approaches for a procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery done using a laparoscope.

Concepts.definition: Surgery done using a laparoscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.::1: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.::1: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.::2: Laparoscopic examination of the abdominal cavity and its contents.

Concepts.definition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery done using a laparoscope.::1: The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.::2: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.::3: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.::4: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Surgery done using a laparoscope.
The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of laparoscopic surgery where the surgeon uses both a laparoscope and his or her hand to help with dissection, retraction, and removal of tissue through a hand port incision.

Concepts.definition: A type of laparoscopic surgery where the surgeon uses both a laparoscope and his or her hand to help with dissection, retraction, and removal of tissue through a hand port incision.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Laparoscopic examination of the abdominal cavity and its contents.::1: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.::2: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.::1: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.::2: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (thor-a-KAH-toe-mee) An operation to open the chest.: Endoscopic surgery of the pleural cavity performed with visualization via video transmission.

Concepts.definition: Surgical opening of the mediastinum.
Thoracic surgery that is aided by the use of a video camera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic surgery of the pleural cavity performed with visualization via video transmission.

Concepts.definition: Thoracic surgery that is aided by the use of a video camera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.: (lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.

Concepts.definition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Definition not available.

Concepts.definition: Definition not available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest possible quantity.: Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.

Concepts.definition: The smallest possible quantity.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Passing through the nose.::1: A procedure that uses an endoscope to examine the inside of the body. An endoscope is a thin, tube-like instrument with a light and a lens for viewing. It may also have a tool to remove tissue to be checked under a microscope for signs of disease.

Concepts.definition: Passing through the nose.
A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Passing through a ventricle.::1: A procedure that uses an endoscope to examine the inside of the body. An endoscope is a thin, tube-like instrument with a light and a lens for viewing. It may also have a tool to remove tissue to be checked under a microscope for signs of disease.

Concepts.definition: Passing through a ventricle.
A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.::1: Having been removed by surgery.::2: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.::3: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.
Having been removed by surgery.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No value exists.: The removal of tissue or fluid with a needle for examination under a microscope. When a wide needle is used, the procedure is called a core biopsy. When a thin needle is used, the procedure is called a fine-needle aspiration biopsy.

Concepts.definition: No value exists.
The removal of a tissue sample using a needle, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: No value exists.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
No value exists.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endoscopic laser microsurgical procedure performed through the mouth for patients with early or medium stage head and neck cancers.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs tumor resection through the mouth using a microscope for visualization and a CO2 laser for incisions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery in which a robot with arms is used to remove cancer from hard-to-reach areas of the mouth and throat. Cameras attached to the robot give a 3-dimensional (3D) image that a surgeon can see. The surgeon guides tools at the ends of the robot arms to remove the cancer.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of ultrasound imaging to guide needle aspiration through the bronchial wall.

Concepts.definition: The use of ultrasound imaging to guide needle aspiration through the bronchial wall.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of endoscopic ultrasound  imaging for real-time guidance to identify and approach lesions for fine-needle aspiration.

Concepts.definition: The use of endoscopic ultrasound imaging for real-time guidance to identify and approach lesions for fine-needle aspiration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.: The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

Concepts.definition: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibers that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body. The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (e.g., biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibers that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body. The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (e.g., biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Microsurgical biopsy

A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibers that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body. The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (e.g., biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibers that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body. The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (e.g., biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Microsurgical resection

A surgical procedure for rectal cancer that involves the removal of the rectum by combining abdominal and transanal endoscopic approaches to overcome limitations of standard laparoscopic total mesorectal excision.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure for rectal cancer that involves the removal of the rectum by combining abdominal and transanal endoscopic approaches to overcome limitations of standard laparoscopic total mesorectal excision.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
